page.title: 14 LACE-MAKING IN DENTON
page.content: Lace-making was once a widespread cottage industry & at one time men made lace because they could earn more than they could working in the fields. Lace schools were set up in many villages and about a century ago a lace school was held in a cottage in Bedford Road Denton where children of 6 & 7 were taught Bedfordshire-Maltese lace. It is not now possible to earn a living from lace-making but it is gaining popularity as a hobby. Three ladies from the village travel weekly to classes in Northampton. In July 1985 a lace-maker from Strixton came to speak to the children at Denton School. They were fascinated by it and enjoyed learning Whole Stitch on a demonstation pillow. Perhaps some will be inspired to join the many present day lacemakers.
